uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model

Class CNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.CValue<V>
      • uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.CDataValue<INumber>
        • uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.CNumber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CEntity, FEntity

    public class CNumber
extends CDataValue<INumber>
    Represents a numeric value-type, defined via a primitive Java Number type and specific numeric range.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      INumber asINumber()
      Provides an instance-level representation of this numeric value-type.
      boolean constrained()
      Stipulates that this numeric value-type defines specific constraints on the number values that it defines if and only if it has any defined limits.
      boolean contains(CNumber other)
      Tests whether the range of the other specified numeric value-type is fully contained within the range of this one.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      Tests for equality between this and other specified object, which will hold if and only if the other object is another CNumber with same numeric value-type and limit-values as this one.
      boolean exactValue()
      Specifies whether this numeric value-type represents an exact value, which will be the case if the minimum and maximum values are equals.
      CNumber getIntersection(CNumber other)
      Produces a new numeric value-type with the same primitive Java Number type as this one, whose range is the intersection of the ranges of this and the other specified numeric value-type.
      INumber getMax()
      Provides the maximum value for the numeric value-type (if no maximum value has been defined this will be INumber.PLUS_INFINITY).
      INumber getMin()
      Provides the minimum value for the numeric value-type (if no minimum value has been defined this will be INumber.MINUS_INFINITY).
      java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Number> getNumberType()
      Provides the primitive Java Number type for the numeric value-type.
      java.lang.Class<INumber> getValueType()
      Specifies the class of the value-entities defined by this value-type-entity.
      int hashCode()
      Provides hash-code based on number-type and limit-values.
      boolean hasMax()
      Specifies whether a maximum value has been defined for the numeric value-type.
      boolean hasMin()
      Specifies whether a minimum value has been defined for the numeric value-type.
      boolean hasNumberType(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Number> testNumberType)
      Tests whether the primitive Java Number type of the numeric value-type is equal to a specified type.
      boolean intersectsWith(CNumber other)
      Tests whether the range of the other specified numeric value-type intersects with the range of this one.
      boolean onePossibleValue()
      Stipulates that this numeric value-type defines only a single possible value if and only if it represents an exact value (see exactValue()).
      boolean subsumes(CValue<?> other)
      Tests whether this value-type-entity subsumes another specified value-type-entity, which will be the case if and only if the other value-type-entity is another CNumber object, with the primitive Java Number type as this one, and whose range is fully contained within the range of this one, as determined via the contains(uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.CNumber) method.
      CNumber toUnconstrained()
      Provides the unconstrained version of this numeric value-type, which will be a numeric value-type with the same number-type but no minimum or maximum values.
      boolean validNumberValue(java.lang.String value)
      Tests whether the provided string represents a valid number of the relevant type.

        public CNumber toUnconstrained()
        Provides the unconstrained version of this numeric value-type, which will be a numeric value-type with the same number-type but no minimum or maximum values.

      • onePossibleValue

        public boolean onePossibleValue()
        Stipulates that this numeric value-type defines only a single possible value if and only if it represents an exact value (see exactValue()). If so then that exact value will be the single possible value.
        Specified by:
        onePossibleValue in class CValue<INumber>
        Returns:
        True if numeric value-type represents an exact value

      • hasNumberType

        public boolean hasNumberType(java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Number> testNumberType)

        Parameters:
        testNumberType - Number type to test for
        Returns:
        True if numeric value-type is of specified type

      • exactValue

        public boolean exactValue()
        Specifies whether this numeric value-type represents an exact value, which will be the case if the minimum and maximum values are equals.
        Returns:
        True if exact value

      • getMax

        public INumber getMax()
        Provides the maximum value for the numeric value-type (if no maximum value has been defined this will be INumber.PLUS_INFINITY).
        Returns:
        Maximum value for the numeric value-type

      • subsumes

        public boolean subsumes(CValue<?> other)
        Tests whether this value-type-entity subsumes another specified value-type-entity, which will be the case if and only if the other value-type-entity is another CNumber object, with the primitive Java Number type as this one, and whose range is fully contained within the range of this one, as determined via the contains(uk.ac.manchester.cs.mekon.model.CNumber) method.
        Specified by:
        subsumes in class CValue<INumber>
        Parameters:
        other - Other value-type-entity to test for subsumption
        Returns:
        True if this value-type-entity subsumes other value-type-entity

        Returns:

      • getIntersection

        public CNumber getIntersection(CNumber other)
        Produces a new numeric value-type with the same primitive Java Number type as this one, whose range is the intersection of the ranges of this and the other specified numeric value-type.
        Parameters:
        other - Other numeric value-type to whose range is to be intersected
        Returns:
        Resulting numeric value-type

      • asINumber

        public INumber asINumber()
        Provides an instance-level representation of this numeric value-type. If the numeric value-type represents an exact value (see exactValue()) then the returned object will represent that particular value, otherwise it will represent the appropriate indefinite value (see INumber.indefinite()).
        Returns:
        Instance-level representation of this numeric value-type
